intro: Pedicularis lanata var. alopecuroides, commonly known as the woolly monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
